items.title: Tata Motors Commercial Vehicles shares debut at 28% premium. Should investors stay on board?
items.description: Tata Motors Commercial Vehicles Share Price: TMLCV shares opened at Rs 335 on the NSE, up 28.5% from the implied value of Rs 260.75, and at Rs 330.25 on the BSE, a 26.6% gain, reflecting solid investor appetite even as analysts expect near-term volatility.

items.title: Groww shares list at 14% premium over IPO price
items.description: Groww, India's largest investment platform, debuted on Dalal Street with a 14% premium, listing at Rs 114 and Rs 112 on BSE and NSE respectively. The Rs 6,632-crore IPO saw strong subscription, particularly from institutional investors. Analysts view Groww as a proxy for India's expanding financialization trend, recommending it as a medium-to-long-term investment opportunity.

items.title: HFCL, Premier Explosives stocks flash bullish signals, indicating possible uptrend
items.description: In the NSE list of stocks with a market cap of over Rs 1,000 crore, 15 stocks appeared in the bullish scanner for the 'White Marubozu' pattern on November 11, according to StockEdge.com's technical scan data. Of these, we highlighted six stocks that gained over 5%. A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis. It occurs when the opening price is the lowest for a given period, and the closing price is the highest.Represented by a long white (or green) candlestick with no upper shadow and a small or nonexistent lower shadow, it indicates strong buying pressure throughout the session. Traders interpret it as a signal that buyers were in control from the opening to the closing, often using such patterns for informed decisions about future price movements in financial markets."

items.title: Infosys, TCS tumble up to 27% as IT meltdown drags Nifty vs global peers. Where's the heartbeat index headed?
items.description: India's Nifty index shows modest one-year returns, lagging global peers. The IT sector, particularly Infosys and TCS, has dragged performance down. Financials, however, have been strong performers, delivering significant returns. Analysts anticipate a constructive outlook for Nifty over the next year, expecting stability and selective recovery in key sectors.

items.title: Torrent Power shares in focus as Q2 PAT rises 50% YoY to Rs 742 crore
items.description: Torrent Power reported a significant 49.6% surge in profit after tax to Rs 742 crore for Q2 FY26, driven by a 9.8% revenue increase to Rs 7,876 crore. Improved merchant power sales and reduced finance costs bolstered performance. Despite higher depreciation, the company's strong quarterly results are expected to draw investor attention.

items.title: Infosys, TCS, and other IT stocks in focus as Trump signals softer stance on H-1B visas
items.description: U.S. President Donald Trump acknowledged the country’s need for skilled foreign workers, even as his administration moved to tighten visa regulations impacting global tech firms. In a Fox News interview, Trump was questioned about the future of H-1B visas and whether his administration planned to deprioritize them, according to Bloomberg.

items.title: Thermax shares in focus Q2 net profit tumbles 40% to Rs 119 crore; revenue down 5%
items.description: Thermax shares: The energy and environment solutions firm delivered a weak Q2 performance, with revenue down 5% year-on-year to Rs 2,474 crore and PAT plunging 40% to Rs 119 crore. PBT fell 35% to Rs 174 crore. Last year’s quarter had been boosted by a one-time Rs 66 crore incentive from the Maharashtra government under the PSI 2007 scheme.

items.title: Tata Motors is the worst-performing PV stock this year. Is it also the most undervalued to buy?
items.description: Tata Motors has become the worst-performing passenger vehicle stock this year, sliding over 12% due to market share loss in EVs and struggles in its premium SUV portfolio. Despite global headwinds for JLR, analysts suggest the stock is undervalued, trading at a steep discount to peers, making it an attractive option for patient, long-term investors.

items.title: Sensex rises 500 pts, Nifty tops 25,800 as U.S. trade hopes lift mood
items.description: Indian stocks surged on Wednesday, led by financials and IT, as optimism grew over a potential US trade deal and an end to the US government shutdown. The Sensex and Nifty both opened higher, reflecting boosted investor confidence in the market.

items.title: Bajaj Finserv among 7 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open interest
items.description: There was a notable surge in futures open interest for seven stocks in the NSE F&O pack on November 11, contributing to a total increase in open interest of over 5% as compared to the previous trade. A significant uptick in futures open interest signifies a substantial growth in the number of active, unexpired futures contracts in a specific security. This uptrend reflects an increasing number of participants either initiating new positions or expanding the size of their existing positions within the futures market.

items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold: BofA maintains underperform on Vodafone; Goldman Sachs recommend sell on ONGC
items.description: Global brokerages express caution on Indian stocks. Bank of America maintains an Underperform rating on Vodafone Idea citing high debt and slow growth. Goldman Sachs reiterates Sell ratings on ONGC and Bajaj Finserv due to uninspiring earnings and valuations. These firms are closely watching company performance and future growth prospects.

items.title: Biocon shares in focus as company swings to Rs 84 crore profit in Q2
items.description: Biocon reported a strong turnaround in Q2FY26 with a net profit of Rs 84.5 crore against a loss of Rs 16 crore last year, driven by 21% YoY revenue growth to Rs 4,389 crore. Biosimilars led with 61% of revenue. The company also repaid key debts, aiming to boost margins and cut interest costs by FY27.

items.title: The Rs 1.5 lakh crore paradox: Why FIIs are dumping stocks but chasing IPOs
items.description: Foreign institutional investors are divesting from Indian secondary markets while actively investing in IPOs, a trend termed 'The great divergence'. This split is driven by different investor types and a pursuit of valuation arbitrage, with long-term investors favoring primary markets for strategic entry points.

items.title: Ather Energy among 7 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
items.description: Nine stocks from the Nifty500 pack that gained over 3% were highlighted in the RSI Trending Up scan on November 11, based on data from StockEdge.com. It is an uptrend signal if the RSI value has crossed above 50 from below. "RSI trending up" means that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are increasing, suggesting strengthening momentum in the price of the stock. This can indicate potential upward movement and may be used by traders to identify buying opportunities.

items.title: RVNL shares drop 3% as PAT declines 20% YoY for Q2FY26
items.description: RVNL share price: Rail Vikas Nigam Ltd (RVNL) reported a 19.7% year-on-year decline in Q2FY26 profit after tax to Rs 230 crore, even as revenue rose 5.5% to Rs 5,123 crore. EBITDA fell 20% and margins narrowed, reflecting cost pressures amid moderate top-line growth.

items.title: SoftBank tanks 10% after $5.8-bn Nvidia stock sale
items.description: SoftBank has sold its entire stake in chip giant Nvidia for $5.8 billion. This move aims to generate cash for significant artificial intelligence investments. These include the ambitious US megaproject Stargate. SoftBank is a key investor in OpenAI, the creator of ChatGPT. The company reported a substantial profit increase in its latest quarter.

items.title: ONGC shares rise 2% despite 18% drop in Q2 profit. Check target price by Nomura, Goldman Sachs
items.description: ONGC shares rose up to 2.5% to Rs 255 on Wednesday despite an 18% YoY drop in Q2 profit to Rs 9,848 crore, weighed down by lower oil prices. Revenue slipped 2.5% to Rs 33,031 crore. The company announced an interim dividend of Rs 6 per share, with a total payout of Rs 7,548 crore.

items.title: Groww shares rally up to 11% after strong D-Street debut. Should investors book profits now?
items.description: Groww share price: Shares of Billionbrains Garage Ventures, the parent of investment platform Groww, extended gains post a strong debut, hitting an intraday high of Rs 124, up 24% from the IPO price of Rs 100. The stock listed at Rs 114 on the BSE and Rs 112 on the NSE

items.title: Infosys’ Rs 18,000 cr buyback: 10 things to know ahead of Nov 14 record date
items.description: Infosys, India's second-largest IT services company, had announced its biggest-ever share buyback programme on September 12, 2025. The company aims to buy back 10 crore equity shares, marking a significant capital return to shareholders.The buyback is offering a 19% premium over the market price at the time of announcement. This is the fourth buyback by Infosys since 2017 and the largest in its history. Here’s all you need to know:

items.title: Hitting it out of the park: 10 small & micro firms that clocked up to 700% profit growth in Q2
items.description: The September quarter saw several lesser-known small and micro-cap companies surprise the Street with extraordinary earnings growth. Despite a volatile market and cost pressures, these firms reported massive jumps in profits, with some seeing over 700% YoY growth in net earnings. Note: The market cap for these companies is below Rs 10,000 crore.

items.title: 500% rally in 5 months, 10 lower circuits, and a mild rebound: Should you ride the dizzying swings of Stallion India?
items.description: Stallion India Fluorochemicals experienced a dramatic 500% rally followed by a sharp 50% correction, marked by ten lower circuits. The stock is now showing tentative signs of recovery after profit booking and stretched valuations impacted its steep decline. The company operates in a niche, growing fluorochemicals market with expansion plans.

items.title: Tata Motors Commercial Vehicles hits top gear on debut post demerger. Here are 7 takeaways from the listing
items.description: Tata Motors Commercial Vehicles (TMLCV) made a robust debut, listing at a 28% premium as investors cheered the demerger and bet on a revival in India’s truck and bus cycle. The stock opened at Rs 335 on the NSE and later rose 3% to Rs 345, reflecting strong confidence in the standalone business and its growth prospects.

items.title: Quantitative tightening brings forward BoE’s valuation losses
items.description: The Bank of England said that the wider benefits from its past bond purchases mostly offset the large losses in its quantitative easing (QE) portfolio. This has become a politically sensitive issue because the government must cover the losses. The BoE has updated its estimate of the net lifetime loss from QE to between £60 and £120 billion, up from £55–115 billion in August. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: US government shutdown shaves up to 1.5% off growth, recovery expected next year
items.description: White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett said the U.S. economy is expected to return to a growth rate of 3–4% by the first quarter of 2026. He attributed the recent slowdown to the government shutdown, which reduced growth by about 1 to 1.5 percentage points from last year’s nearly 4% pace. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Reliance Infra shares gain 5% despite 50% drop in Q2 net profit to Rs 1,911 crore
items.description: Reliance Infrastructure shares rose sharply despite a 50% year-on-year drop in Q2FY26 net profit to Rs 1,911 crore. Revenue from operations fell 14% to Rs 6,235 crore, with the power business continuing to be the primary contributor to the company’s overall earnings mix.

items.title: Smallcaps on fire! Top 10 stocks that have rallied up to 178% in just 3 months
items.description: India’s smallcap segment has been on a tear, with select counters clocking triple-digit returns in just three months. From defence to tyres, banks to chemicals, the rally has been broad-based — reflecting strong earnings momentum, improving sentiment, and renewed investor appetite for high-growth stories. Here are the top 10 smallcap gainers over the last quarter, as per data from ACE Equity.

items.title: A Strategic Supper: Trump engages corporate America for economic policy reset
items.description: US President Donald Trump is expected to host a private dinner at the White House on Wednesday with top business executives, including the CEOs of Nasdaq and JPMorgan Chase. The gathering aims to strengthen ties between the government and corporate leaders as the administration seeks to engage industry in its economic revival plans. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Record date for Allcargo Logistics demerger today: Key details investors should know
items.description: Allcargo Logistics’ demerger of its international supply chain business into a new listed entity, Allcargo Global, takes effect today. Shareholders will receive one Allcargo Global share for every Allcargo Logistics share held. The record date, revised from November 10 to November 12, determines eligible shareholders. The demerger became effective on November 1 after NCLT approval.

items.title: How will the market be in 2026? Watch out for what managements of these 26 companies say in the next 60 days
items.description: After the additional US tariffs were imposed in August, who is most likely to have the earliest and most accurate information on what is happening to India’s imports and exports? Besides government agencies, it will be the companies running ports. So, if a port operator warns in its earnings call about the volume of cargo it is likely to handle in the next few months, it should be taken seriously. This is an example of why it is important to keep track of what managements of some companies say. They feel the pulse of the economy. And, in the end, it is the economy that drives earnings, and earnings that drive the stock market. So, here is a set of companies that will have a better idea of what to expect in 2026.

items.title: European shares hit record highs on hopes of US shutdown ending; earnings in focus
items.description: European shares hit a record high on Wednesday as investors were relieved by a potential end to a historic U.S. government shutdown and also assessed corporate updates from UK's SSE and France's Edenred.

items.title: NDR InvIT Trust reports 36% YoY PAT growth, revenue hits Rs 1036 crore in Q2 FY26
items.description: NDR InvIT Trust, India’s pioneering Perpetual Warehousing and Industrial Parks InvIT, announced robust financial results for the quarter ended September 30, 2025 (Q2 FY26), reporting a Profit After Tax (PAT) of INR 366.02 million.

items.title: Groww's debut is a bet on middle-class animal spirits
items.description: Groww's successful stock listing highlights a major change in how Indians invest. Digital platforms like Groww make investing simple, like online shopping. This has brought many middle-class individuals into the stock market. The trend shows a growing confidence in equities as a way to build wealth. This shift is reshaping India's financial landscape.

items.title: SBI Funds, DSP, Think India invest Rs 144 crore in Aequs through pre-IPO placement
items.description: Aequs Ltd. raised around ₹144 crore through a pre-IPO placement by issuing 1.16 crore shares at ₹123.97 each to marquee investors, including SBI Funds Management, DSP India Fund, and Think India Opportunities Master Fund.

items.title: F&O Radar| Deploy Bull Call Spread in Nifty to play index bullishness amid mkt volatility
items.description: The Nifty index recovered strongly after early losses, closing with gains of 120 points near 25,700. Analysts maintain a bullish view, suggesting a Bull Call Spread amid sustained market momentum.

items.title: Japan's Nikkei rises as SoftBank Group trims losses; Topix hits new high
items.description: Japan's Nikkei share average rose on Wednesday, extending gains after SoftBank Group trimmed losses, while Sony Group helped the broader Topix to close at a fresh high on a robust annual profit forecast.

items.title: Why is the stock market surging today? Sensex jumps over 700 pts, Nifty above 25,900; Here are 6 factors steering D-St higher
items.description: Indian stocks surged Wednesday, led by financials and IT, as optimism grew over a potential U.S. trade deal and an end to the government shutdown. Positive U.S. labor data fueled rate-cut hopes, while Bihar exit polls favored the ruling NDA. Strong corporate earnings, including RIL's gains, further boosted domestic sentiment.

items.title: Banking on transformative banking regulations
items.description: RBI’s latest banking reforms mark a new era for India’s financial sector, enabling universal bank transitions, foreign investments, M&A financing, and operational flexibility to drive growth and global integration.

items.title: CDSL shares gain 3%, up for 4th consecutive session. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.description: CDSL shares climbed 3% to Rs 1,650 on Wednesday, marking a fourth consecutive day of gains. This surge follows the company's second-quarter results, which showed a year-on-year profit decline but a sequential increase. Analysts remain divided, with one downgrading the stock while another maintains a buy rating, citing a healthy IPO pipeline and market recovery.

items.title: Bhavish Aggarwal raises loans by pledging 25% more Ola Electric shares. Should investors be worried?
items.description: Ola Electric chairman Bhavish Aggarwal has further pledged his company shares. This is the third time he has used Ola Electric stock to finance a separate, private venture. This move raises questions about founder risk for shareholders. Ola Electric shares have seen a significant decline since its listing and following Aggarwal's previous pledges.

items.title: Nifty may crash 5-7% if Bihar election math tilts against NDA, warns InCred
items.description: InCred Equities warned that the Nifty could fall 5–7% if the NDA loses the Bihar election, triggering political uncertainty and foreign outflows. However, analysts expect the correction to be short-lived, with markets rebounding once policy clarity and economic stability return under any new coalition government.

items.title: Adani Enterprises shares rally over 6% as board approves Rs 25,000 crore rights issue. Check key dates and other details
items.description: Adani Enterprises shares: The stock soared after the company finalized terms for its ₹25,000 crore rights issue. The issue, involving partly paid-up equity shares of ₹1 face value, aims to strengthen the company’s capital base and support future growth plans, the firm said in an exchange filing.

items.title: ET Prime Special Series: Multibagger or IBC - Part 32: 36% revenue from EVs, and now an expansion beyond auto
items.description: Numbers tell the story. Battery EV revenue share has climbed from 25% in FY22 to 36% in FY25 even as ICE-dependent products receded to 9%. The order book is tilted about 70% to EV programs, with PVs still the anchor, and meaningful E2W/E3W and CV contributions. End-market and geography are rebalancing. Non-automotive revenue reached 28% in H1 FY26, and India’s revenue share rose to 45% while North America eased to 30%. The strategic question is execution: Can the company translate diversification, PLI benefits, and an innovative rare-earth-free motor into higher kit value and margins? This series on auto ancillary companies works with the assumption that, from the whole set of auto ancillary companies, some multibagger stocks will emerge. And some companies in this space risk going bankrupt.

items.title: Two Trades for Today: A pharma major for a 5.1% rise, a mid-cap ship-building stock for an almost 7% upmove
items.description: Our technical analysts identify select stocks that may gain momentum even in volatile markets. Here are the technical calls for today.

items.title: Market Trading Guide: Buy CarTrade, CDSL and 3 more stocks on Thursday for up to 12% gains
items.description: Headline index Nifty continued its positive run for the third day in a row on Wednesday led by buying action in IT and auto stocks. The index has moved above the 21EMA, confirming the prevailing uptrend.Commenting on the day's action, Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities said that the index has continued to rally higher following a retest of the falling channel breakout on the daily chart. “The sentiment might remain positive in the short term, with the index potentially reaching 26,000. On the lower end, immediate support is placed at 25,700," De said.Here are 5 stock recommendations for Thursday:

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Thursday
items.description: Indian markets closed higher for the third straight day, with Sensex rising 595 points and Nifty up 181 points, led by gains in financials, IT, and auto stocks. Positive global cues, easing inflation, and firm domestic macro data lifted investor sentiment.

items.title: Unregulated digital gold's return risk: You lose 6% the moment you buy, explains Zerodha’s Nithin Kamath
items.description: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath supported Sebi’s warning on digital gold, calling it unregulated and inefficient. He cautioned that buyers lose nearly 6% upfront due to GST and spreads, urging investors to choose gold ETFs for safer exposure instead.

items.title: US stocks gain as investors anticipate end to federal shutdown
items.description: Wall Street opened higher on Wednesday with the Dow at a record high, as investors cheered a likely end to the longest U.S. government shutdown, while an upbeat earnings outlook from Advanced Micro Devices revived optimism around AI.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Groww, HAL among 8 stocks that moved most on Wednesday
10 midcap stocks where DIIs trimmed stakes in Q2
items.description: A decrease in DII (Domestic Institutional Investor) shareholding typically indicates that domestic investors are reducing their exposure to a particular stock. This could suggest a lack of confidence in the stock’s future performance, potential concerns about market conditions, or a shift in investment strategy. We have highlighted the top 10 stocks in the NSE midcap with decreased DII shareholding in September '25 on a quarter-on-quarter basis, according to StockEdge's shareholding scan.

items.title: Conflict of interest: Top panel finds rules for Sebi officials inadequate, proposes public disclosure of assets
items.description: Sebi's conflict-of-interest rules are deemed inadequate, lacking legal teeth and consistency. A high-level committee found existing codes voluntary, unlike enforceable employee regulations. Recommendations include a new, legally binding framework for all officials, standardizing definitions, enhancing disclosures, and strengthening post-employment restrictions to bolster public trust.

items.title: Asian Paints shares jump 6% to fresh 52-week high on 43% Q2 PAT growth, interim dividend announcement
items.description: Asian Paints shares hit a fresh 52-week high of Rs 2,838.70 on Wednesday, closing up 6.6% at Rs 2,832 on the NSE. The rally came after the company reported a 43% YoY rise in Q2 consolidated net profit to Rs 994 crore, with revenue up 6% to Rs 8,514 crore.

items.title: Asian Paints, Adani Ports among 9 largecap stocks that hit 52-week highs; gained up to 25% in a month
items.description: On Wednesday, the benchmark Sensex jumped around 595 points to close at 84,466. During the rally, nine stocks from the BSE Largecap Index touched their 52-week highs — marking their strongest levels in a year. Such breakouts are often viewed by traders and investors as bullish signals, indicating strong upward momentum and the possibility of further gains ahead.

items.title: Stock Radar: 20% fall from highs! This pharma stock is showing signs of bottoming out
items.description: Ipca Laboratories is showing signs of a bullish reversal with a rounding bottom pattern forming on daily charts, suggesting bulls are gaining control. Experts recommend short-term traders with a high-risk profile consider buying the stock for a potential target above Rs 1,400 in the coming weeks.

items.title: Sebi plans wide-ranging reforms to woo foreign investors: Tuhin Kanta Pandey
items.description: India's markets regulator is planning more reforms to woo foreign investors, including speeding up registration, reducing the cost of trading in the cash equities market and making it easier to short-sell, its chief said on Wednesday.

items.title: Sebi proposes mandatory asset disclosures for top officials
items.description: A committee of India's markets regulator has recommended requiring the chairman and senior officers to publicly disclose their assets and liabilities, to boost transparency and accountability.

items.title: HAL shares slip 3% after results as margins miss guidance despite profit growth
items.description: HAL shares slipped on Wednesday after the Q2 results as margins fell short of guidance despite a 10% rise in profit. Revenue growth met expectations, but cost pressures hit operating performance. Analysts noted that while near-term sentiment is weak, the stock’s long-term uptrend remains intact.

items.title: Goldman Sachs says Reliance Industries, Titan Company and 12 other stocks to lead next market rally. Check full list
items.description: Goldman Sachs has turned bullish on India, upgrading it to ‘Overweight’ and predicting Nifty at 29,000 by end-2026. The brokerage identified 14 stocks across sectors — including Titan, Reliance, Maruti Suzuki, and NTPC — that could spearhead the next leg of market gains, driven by structural reforms, rising consumption, and strong corporate earnings visibility.

items.title: These mid-cap stocks with ‘Strong Buy’ & ‘Buy’ recos can rally over 25%, according to analysts
items.description: The way things are panning out in the markets, the bulls are steadily but clearly gaining control. Yes, we will continue to see small phases of correction, but the overall bias is expected to remain towards the bulls. The likely difference this time is that the market may be more stock- or even sector-specific. This will be unlike the past when it was an across-the-board rally, especially in mid-caps.
